content: This guide will walk you through the basic functions available in the Chain Core Dashboard. This dashboard is built into the Chain Core binary, and is available at all times when your server is running.
If this is your first time launching Chain Core, or you're just looking for a refresher, click "Start" and let's begin.

title: Tutorial - Creating Keys - Step 1 of 7
content: Cryptographic private keys are the primary authorization mechanism on a blockchain. They control both the issuance and transfer of asset units. An asset or account will define one or more keys required for issuance or transfers.
For development environments, Chain Core provides a convenient MockHSM that simulates production behaviors. Let's begin by creating a new key in our HSM.

steps.title: Enter an alias for your key (ex. 'goldkey')

description.line: An alias is a friendly label used to distinguish between keys. We will use this alias in the next step.

content.line: Great work! You created a new key in the MockHSM named "STRING". Next up, we'll learn about assets and how to create them.

title: Tutorial - Creating Assets - Step 2 of 7
content: An asset is a type of value that can be issued on a blockchain. All units of an asset are fungible and can be transacted directly between parties without the involvement of the issuer.
Let's create a new asset now.

steps.title: Enter an alias for your asset (ex. 'gold')

description.line: An alias is a friendly label used to distinguish between assets.

steps.title: Select "Use existing MockHSM key" under "Keys and Signing"

description.line: Choose STRING key from the dropdown

content.line: Great! You created a new asset type named "STRING". Next up, we'll learn about accounts and create them for two parties who want to trade assets.

title: Tutorial - Creating Accounts - Step 3 of 7
content: An account is an object in Chain Core that tracks ownership of assets on a blockchain by creating and tracking control programs. The account object does not exist on the blockchain - it is local to this Chain Core. Only the control programs created in the account are visible on the blockchain.
We'll be moving assets from one account to another; let's create the first one now.

description.line: An account alias is a label used to distinguish between accounts.

steps.title: Type name for key to generate new MockHSM key (ex. 'alice key', 'bob key')

description.line: This key will be used for the issuance and transfer of asset units in this account.

content.line: Great! You created an account for STRING.
Next, you will create a second account to interact with the newly created STRING account.
